title: Interdisciplinary Simulation for Elementary Education Programming Environment Design: Strengthening Algorithm Problem-Solving and Computational Thinking through Mathematics-Engineering Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts (loops, conditionals, operations), understanding of mathematics education theories (patterns, functions, variables), mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills, and foundational graph and statistics concepts
context.additional_context: VR-based simulation for designing interdisciplinary lessons using elementary programming tools (block coding, visual programming languages). Focuses on integrating mathematical concepts (patterns, functions, variables, equations) with programming elements (loops, conditionals, operations). Learners apply scientific inquiry methods (measurement, analysis, evidence-based conclusions) in algorithmic problem-solving.

learning_goals: Analysis of technical and pedagogical characteristics of elementary programming environments, application of mathematical logic structures (functions, variables, patterns) classification systems, and computational thinking assessment

Learners will design problem-solving processes for three algorithm types (sorting, searching, shortest path) using VR simulation tools (e.g., Unity ML-Agents) and submit reports meeting ≥4 of 5 formative assessment checklist items, including formulaic and graphical analysis
Designing age-appropriate programming learning environments based on interdisciplinary approaches and evaluating computational thinking through mathematical proofs and engineering implementations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
